page.title: 01GOODWOOD HOUSE
page.content: Goodwood house was originally built in 1616. It was a hunting lodge. The house was bought by the first Duke of Richmond in 1694 and has been the home of all Dukes since. There is a fascinating collection of family portraits dating from King Charles. They show the changing of fashion and the continuing family likenesses. There are woven tapestries ordered by the King of France. There are loveley bird and flower paintings on a collection of porcelain by Serves beautifully displayed. There are many objects once owned by famous people. The plate Napoleon used at breakfast on the morning of the Battle of Waterloo and the emerald given by King Charles 11 to the mother of the first Duke of Richmond. By Debbie Collins.
